Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw at least two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can illustrate various types of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and animals like lizards, squirrels, and fish.
The student can organize the drawing to show a variety of living things in each habitat.
The student can highlight differences between the types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can display patterns or similarities among the living things in different habitats through their drawing.
